text: Colonel Ely Ould Mohamed Vall (1953 - 5 May 2017) was a political and military figure in Mauritania. He served as the transitional military leader of Mauritania following a coup d'état in August 2005 until 19 April 2007, when he gave up his power to an elected government."Mauritania's new military leader", BBC.co.uk, August 8, 2005."Political Transition in Mauritania" , International Crisis Group, April 24, 2006. Vall died on 5 May 2017 from a heart attack in Zouerate at the age of 64.Mauritanie: décès de l'ancien président mauritanien Ely Ould Mohamed Vall (2005-2007) ==References== Category:1953 births Category:2017 deaths Category:African military people Category:Colonels Category:Deaths from myocardial infarction Category:Presidents of Mauritania
title: Ely Ould Mohamed Vall
